intro: Schoenolaena tenuior, commonly known as the slender grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae, and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Schoenolaena tenuior is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
